comment.body:
The images are loaded fine on my end with our filters.
Screenshot: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33488229/213389627-db01aa44-a8a6-4eb2-a68d-3bb660540ced.png)

Please do next when you see the blocked image: 1. Visit the site without AdGuard and watch if you still have the issue 2. If it's ok, turn on AdGuard with your configuration 3. If you see the problem, try to disable filters one by one to find the problematic one 4. When you find it, open the filtering log, reproduce the problem, send the screenshot of the filtering log under the spoiler here.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://trello.com/b/UxSwOSpw/rezepte](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftrello.com%2Fb%2FUxSwOSpw%2Frezepte) ### Comment Username: @Scolaro > Screenshot 1 (AdGuard on): I press "Attachment", choose the image I want to upload to the card and get the error message in the lower left corner. > Screenshot 2 (AdGuard off): I press "Attachment", choose the image I want to upload to the card and get the success message. The image appears in the card. > > Every once in a while an image goes through when AdGuard is on (because I forget to turn it off), but it's mostly the first one, then nothing else goes through until I turn AdGuard off. > Oftentimes I also get an error (from Trello on their website) that I am not connected to the server. Everything (creating cards, changing text etc) continues to work except for the image upload, and once AdGuard is off there are no more server error messages on the Trello site either. > Note that all my Trello pages are affected by this issue, not just the "Rezepte" one from the screenshots. ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.golem.de/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.golem.de%2F) ### Comment Username: `@felix-22` > This filter from Adguard Tracking Protection: `||cdn.stroeerdigitalgroup.de^$third-party` causes an AD placeholder appearing on the main page (screenshoot 1), it can be proven by turning off Adguard Tracking Protection or disabling the filter by `badfilter` (`||cdn.stroeerdigitalgroup.de^$third-party,badfilter`), which fixes the AD placholder (screenshoot 2).
